column1: Therefore, it is apparent that the learned Magistrate had not considered the evidence which had
been placed before the Primary Court by the parties, which clearly demonstrates the Appellantâ€™s
right to use the said disputed portion of land as a roadway.
In  this  respect,  it  is  to  be  observed  that  the  roadway  in  question  is  the  only  road  to  access  the
premises bearing assessment no. 1058/5 of Maradana Road, Borella, which the Appellant claimed
the possession of, in Primary Court Case bearing no: B 5749/02/12.
